poem:
"In Memory of the Miner's Strife"

Layered soot of fortitude, 
beneath Thatcher's iron hand. 
Uneconomic pits resist -
a strike's timeless demand.

Muscle-flexing union men,
protest the cool coal's end.
Silhouetted against history,
their rugged plight ascends.

Years, four decades passed, their echo
beneath the furnace and the fume-
Residual energy, from a year-long fight,
in a forgotten miner's tomb.
